extendedIngredients.name: blanched almonds
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup blanched almonds, chopped or slivered (can substitute hazelnuts, peeled)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup blanched almonds, chopped or slivered (can substitute hazelnuts, peeled)
extendedIngredients.originalName: blanched almonds, chopped or slivered (can substitute hazelnuts, peeled)

extendedIngredients.name: canned tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 1 15-ounce can of crushed tomatoes, or canned whole tomatoes (including the juice) that have been de-seeded, or 1 pound fresh tomatoes that have been par-boiled, skins removed, and de-seeded
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 15-ounce can of crushed tomatoes, or canned whole tomatoes (including the juice) that have been de-seeded, or 1 pound fresh tomatoes that have been par-boiled, skins removed, and de-seeded
extendedIngredients.originalName: crushed tomatoes, or canned whole tomatoes (including the juice) that have been de-seeded, or 1 pound fresh tomatoes that have been par-boiled, skins removed, and de-seeded

extendedIngredients.name: crusty bread
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1-inch thick slice of crusty bread, torn into pieces
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1-inch thick slice of crusty bread, torn into pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: 1-inch thick slice of crusty bread, torn into pieces

extendedIngredients.name: red wine vinegar
extendedIngredients.original: 2-3 Tbsp sherry vinegar or red wine vinegar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2-3 Tbsp sherry vinegar or red wine vinegar
extendedIngredients.originalName: sherry vinegar or red wine vinegar

extendedIngredients.name: roasted red bell peppers
extendedIngredients.original: 1 8-ounce jar of roasted red bell peppers, drained
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 8-ounce jar of roasted red bell peppers, drained

extendedIngredients.name: sweet paprika
extendedIngredients.original: 1 Tbsp smoked paprika (preferred) or sweet paprika
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Tbsp smoked paprika (preferred) or sweet paprika

title: Spanish Romesco Sauce
instructions: 1 Preheat the oven to 350°F.  Heat the olive oil in a medium sauté pan over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, sauté the bread and almonds, stirring often, until they just begin to brown. Add the garlic and sauté another 1-2 minutes, stirring once or twice. 2 Place the contents of the sauté pan into a food processor with the remaining ingredients—salt, tomatoes, roasted bell peppers, smoked paprika, vinegar. Purée until smooth. Spread the sauce out on a rimmed sheet pan and bake in the oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the edges begin to caramelize. Allow to cool and scrape into a container to store. To use romesco sauce, mix with pasta, shrimp, chicken or vegetables either before or after they are cooked, much like you would a pesto.Kept in a sealed container, Romesco sauce will last for a week or more in the fridge. It freezes well, too.

steps.step: Heat the olive oil in a medium sauté pan over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, sauté the bread and almonds, stirring often, until they just begin to brown.
Add the garlic and sauté another 1-2 minutes, stirring once or twice. 2
Place the contents of the sauté pan into a food processor with the remaining ingredients—salt, tomatoes, roasted bell peppers, smoked paprika, vinegar. Purée until smooth.

Spread the sauce out on a rimmed sheet pan and bake in the oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the edges begin to caramelize. Allow to cool and scrape into a container to store. To use romesco sauce, mix with pasta, shrimp, chicken or vegetables either before or after they are cooked, much like you would a pesto.Kept in a sealed container, Romesco sauce will last for a week or more in the fridge. It freezes well, too.
